intro: Stenostephanus holm-nielsenii, commonly known as the Holm-Nielsen's stenostephanus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions of Europe. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, aromatic fragrance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
